title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 May 2012 - XWiki
content:

08:15 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: When I run CTS tests from the command line, nothing gets executed  
08:38 <@sdumitriu> Although I can see the tests when running from Eclipse  
08:38 <@sdumitriu> Any idea why?  
08:38 <vmassol> hi sdumitriu  
08:38 <vmassol> there's no reason I can see, they are junit tests so you should see surefire running  
08:39 <@sdumitriu> Surefire is running  
08:39 <@sdumitriu> Just that it detects 0 tests  
08:39 <vmassol> which module for ex?  
08:40 <@sdumitriu> I tried both mediawiki and tex  
08:40 <vmassol> trying tex now  
08:41 <@sdumitriu> Update first, I committed something  
08:43 <vmassol> ok I can reproduce  
08:43 <vmassol> strange, I hadn't noticed it  
08:43 <vmassol> probably some classpath issue, I'll debug it  
08:51 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: you killed me with your commit on office module, need to do a lot of manual merge now..  
08:51 <@sdumitriu> Why, were you working on it?  
08:51 <+mflorea> yep  
08:51 <@sdumitriu> Sorry...  
08:52 <+mflorea> np, my fault I didn't commit earlier  
09:06 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki

09:26 <+tmortagne> could you take care of http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise40#HTestedBrowsers

12:40 <evalica> has quit  
12:41 <+tmortagne> sburjan: thanks  
12:47 <+tmortagne> Denis: did you seen XWIKI-7413 ?  
12:47 <+tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7413  
12:48 <+tmortagne> there is a wiki version cache in the new migrator but it's not cleaned when a wiki is deleted  
12:53 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: did you use push-release.sh for xwiki.org related stuff ? it used to not work  because of REST issues but maybe you modified it to work (asking because I see you uncommented those lines)  
12:54 <+tmortagne> s/REST/Restlet/  
13:13 <sburjan> has quit  
13:26 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <mflorea> has quit  
13:51 <+tmortagne> looks like it's working for blog at least  
13:58 <vmassol> fixing rendering build for the event syntax  
13:59 <+tmortagne> sburjan: you keep testing on FF 3.6 ?  
13:59 <+tmortagne> (seen it in the release note so I'm surprised)  
13:59 <+sburjan> I don't test as on other browsers, buty I also take a look on FF 3.6  
13:59 <+sburjan> afaik 3.6 will be EOL'ed .. so we should vote to drop the support  
14:00 <+tmortagne> that's actually why i'm surprised  
14:00 <+tmortagne> not sure that really need a vote  
14:00 <CIA-74> Vincent Massol master \* r1fa085a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/1fa085a0fe5f3cb3b1b83cac5b0d042dddfbff80 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XRENDERING-187: Implement a Rendering Compatibility Test Suite ...  
14:00 <+tmortagne> I don't see why we would support something Mozilla does not support  
14:00 <vmassol> it needs a vote  
14:00 <vmassol> we've voted to support it  
14:00 <+tmortagne> we were supporting it only for this reason  
14:00 <vmassol> we need a vote remove that  
14:00 <vmassol> the vote allows everyone to understand we're not supporting it anymore  
14:01 <+sburjan> looking if it is EOL'ed  
14:01 <vmassol> nothing to do with mozilla  
14:01 <vmassol> for ex we're going to support java6 for a long tim  
14:01 <vmassol> even though it's eol by oracle  
14:01 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it's not the same, what i'm saying is that we were supporting 3.6 only because Mozilla was supporting it  
14:01 <+tmortagne> we don't support any other version that the last one  
14:02 <vmassol> I don't know about that  
14:02 <vmassol> that's NOT what we said  
14:02 <vmassol> we said:  
14:02 <vmassol> " Firefox 3.6 still has about 50% of all Mozilla browser usages."  
14:02 <vmassol> anyway  
14:02 <vmassol> needs a vote

15:46 <+sburjan> tmortagne: I have downloaded the 4.0 artefact, and I am trying to install LDAP Tools and I get: "We couldn't find any extension with id 'org.xwiki.contrib:xwiki-application-ldaptools' and version '1.0'."  
15:49 <+tmortagne> sburjan: why 1.0 ?  
15:49 <+tmortagne> it's part of platform so it has platform version  
15:49 <+tmortagne> what you are trying to install is the old one  
15:49 <+tmortagne> maybe it has been removed by jvelociter  
15:49 <+sburjan> okay, good to know  
15:50 <+sburjan> maybe we should remove it form the list also  
15:50 <+tmortagne> the list ?  
15:50 <+sburjan> from Extension Manager  
15:51 <+sburjan> I search LDAP in Extension Manager. I have 2 results: LDAP Tools and LDAP Application  
15:51 <+tmortagne> sburjan: the new one work only since 4.0  
15:52 <+tmortagne> as far as I can see the old one is still here  
15:52 <+tmortagne> maybe you use a wrong id  
15:52 <+tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP+Tools  
15:52 <+sburjan> I just unpacked 4.0 and started it. I did nothing custom, just searched for LDAP, and tried to install LDAP Tools .. which I got in the search results  
15:53 <+tmortagne> ok I tough you were using advanced search  
15:53 <+tmortagne> then I don't know  
15:53 <+tmortagne> would need to reproduce it  
15:53 <+tmortagne> could you report an issue ?  
15:54 <+sburjan> yes, let me reproduce it again to make sure  
15:54 <+sburjan> EM is ultra slow, maybe the repo has a lot of requests  
15:55 <+sburjan> I also have some stacktrace. let me try from 0, so I can isolate the issue  
15:57 <polx> has quit  
16:03 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:06 <vmassol> sburjan: would be great if you could finish http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise3xCycle at some point :)  
16:06 <vmassol> since we're now releasing 4.0 we should send a mail closing the 3.x cycle ASAP IMO  
16:07 <+sburjan> never knew about the existence of this page until now :)  
16:07 <vmassol> ah I thought you cerated it, didn't check the author :)  
16:08 <+sburjan> :)  
16:09 <vmassol> was sdumitriu apparently  
16:09 <vmassol> you did the 2.x cycle right http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise2xCycle ?  
16:09 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
16:09 <vmassol> (yup, just checed)  
16:09 <vmassol> which is why I thought you staretd the 3.x one  
16:10 <vmassol> anyway, sburjan or sdumitriu do you think you'd have some time to finish http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise3xCycle ?  
16:10 <@cjd> WDYT for an exception to throw if a tmpdir can't be gotten? Usually for storage related stuff that's not reasonable to expect/recover from, I use org.xwiki.store.UnexpectedException but that's not in commons...  
16:11 <+sburjan> basically we need to look at the release note of each final release and copy the informations from there, right ?  
16:12 <+sburjan> at least this is what I did for 2.x cycle  
16:12 <+tmortagne> sburjan: probably not copy/past everything but the mail points yes  
16:12 <@cjd> I suppose the best answer is to move store-api to commons since it really is common in nature (has no dependencies)  
16:13 <+sburjan> tmortagne: I get a stacktrace only when searching for something on EM, going to report this  
16:13 <+tmortagne> sburjan: ok  
16:13 <polx> has quit  
16:16 <+sburjan> tmortagne: should I put 4.0 in affected since 4.0 is not yet out ?  
16:16 <+tmortagne> sburjan: it is out  
16:17 <+tmortagne> it should be out in jira, it's not ?  
16:17 <+sburjan> it is  
16:17 <+sburjan> just missed the mail :)  
16:17 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:17 <+tmortagne> well since I sent it like 1 min ago...  
16:17 <+tmortagne> but the actual release has been made last Monday  
16:19 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
16:19 <+sburjan> tmortagne: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7777  
16:21 <+sburjan> vmassol: odd thing. "bot", "irc" and "ircbot" returns no result on EM  
16:21 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
16:22 <vmassol> sburjan: IMO the search in EM is not good enough  
16:22 <vmassol> you should talk to tmortagne about it…  
16:22 <+tmortagne> nothing to do with the search  
16:23 <+tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/IRC+Bot+Application is not a valid extension  
16:23 <+tmortagne> i.e. not installable  
16:23 <+tmortagne> so you are never going to find it  
16:23 <vmassol> indeed  
16:23 <vmassol> I'll import it  
16:23 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
16:23 <vmassol> now that it's been released  
16:30 <vmassol> ah made a mistake  
16:30 <vmassol> I should have importer the XAR module  
16:30 <vmassol> deleting history  
16:39 <+sburjan> There is one thing I don't understand tmortagne . If I'm running on 4.0, why LDAP Application has 4.0-milestone-2 when retrieved with the basic search ? All its dependencies are from 4.0-milestone-2, and for 2 of the dependencies I get a notification saying: "Incompatible with provided version 4.0." Also I see it wants to install "XWiki Platform - Administration4.0-milestone-2" .. but I already have that on 4.0. Uninstalling all the dependencies (in this c  
16:39 <+sburjan> ase, will trash your wiki)  
16:40 <vmassol> sburjan: you can try again to search for the IRC Bot app  
16:42 <+sburjan> vmassol: works now !  
16:43 <+tmortagne> sburjan: that's because http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP+Application is not up to date  
16:43 <+sburjan> ok. so not an EM issue  
16:44 <+sburjan> but do we have to update these pages (applications not bundled) on each release ?  
16:45 <+sburjan> also the xar points to M2 ... so EM finds what is there  
16:47 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: I am now  
16:47 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: it's ok now actually :)  
16:48 <+tmortagne> sburjan: we need to write a scheduler for them, extensions.xwiki.org is a bit fuzzy right now  
16:48 <+sburjan> ok

17:31 <vmassol> could be a simple storage for xwiki… nice potential GSOC or 20% time...  
17:32 <vmassol> I'm sure cjd is going to be interested… ;)  
17:35 <@cjd> we do a lot of scanning and searches, my cassandra work is all done in the same jvm as xwiki so it's definitely in the same spirit  
17:37 <@cjd> And with cassandra, I can store arbitrary user defined (java) classes and instanciate objects of those classes and store them as well. Of course you would absolutely hate how that is connected to oldcore objects :)  
17:49 <vmassol> would need to have a look one day at what you did on cassandra )  
17:49 <vmassol> :)
